rooms.description: Spacious entry hall with ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows, designed for smooth transition between outdoors and indoors.
Open-plan living area featuring a large seating space; incorporates Brutalist design elements such as exposed concrete beams and geometric shapes.
Adjacent to the kitchen, with minimalistic furniture and floor-to-ceiling windows that allow abundant natural light.
Modern, functional kitchen with an open layout; designed with Vastu principles for energy flow and balanced spatial arrangement.
Service space adjacent to the kitchen for storage of cleaning supplies and appliances.
Guest bathroom on ground floor incorporating simple, functional design elements typical of Brutalist architecture.

openings.description: Large steel-framed door with reinforced concrete accents, providing a secure entry point.
Floor-to-ceiling windows offering expansive views and maximum natural light in the living area.
Additional window openings designed to ensure balanced ventilation as per Vastu principles.

rooms.description: Largest bedroom with floor-to-ceiling windows for optimal natural lighting, incorporating Brutalist design aesthetics.
Secondary bedroom offering privacy and ample light; designed to be a functional space for individual relaxation.
Additional bedroom tailored to accommodate children or guests with sufficient natural light and ventilation.
Well-appointed bathroom adjacent to the master bedroom, ensuring privacy and comfort.

openings.description: Floor-to-ceiling windows in each room, designed for enhanced light and Vastu-compliant spatial distribution.
Direct access from the upper floor to the rooftop terrace via a staircase or elevator system.
